meanings.definition: To praise or honor someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She was accolading her friend for winning the race.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was accolading the students for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was accolading its owner with joyful barks.
meanings.sent4: The sun accoladed the flowers with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The crowd was accolading the singer with loud cheers.

meanings.definition: The act of bestowing praise or honor on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The accolading of the hero brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent2: The accolading of the artist's work was well-deserved.
meanings.sent3: The cat received accolading from its owner in the form of tasty treats.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be giving accolading to the moon.
meanings.sent5: The accolading of the chef's dish made it the talk of the town.
